seasonQuotes: I went to the woods because I wished to live deliberately... and see if I could not learn what it had to teach. - Henry David Thoreau
If you live among wolves you have to act like a wolf. - Nikita Khrushchev
Extinction is the rule. Survival is the exception. - Carl Sagan
Hunger, love, pain, fear are some of those inner forces which rule the individual's instinct for self preservation. - Albert Einstein
The strong survive, but the courageous triumph. - Michael Scott
Extraordinary people survive under the most terrible circumstances and they become more extraordinary because of it. - Robertson Davies
Humans are not the fastest or the strongest animals on the planet, but when it comes to survival, we have had the unique advantage of being clever. - David Perlmutter
This is the chance in a lifetime. But it's not worth dying over. - Wayne
If quick, I survive. If not quick, I am lost. This is 'death.' - Sun Tzu
Does anything in nature despair except man? - May Sarton
Courage is not having the strength to go on; it is going on when you don't have the strength. - Theodore Roosevelt
The oldest and strongest emotion of mankind is fear, and the oldest and strongest kind of fear is fear of the unknown. - H. P. Lovecraft
The very basic core of a man's living spirit is his passion for adventure. - Christopher McCandless
Use your fear... It can take you to a place where you store your courage. - Amelia Earhart
The instinct to survive will never change, neither will the human body's amazing ability to endure. - John 'Lofty' Wiseman
Strength does not come from physical capacity. It comes from an indomitable will. - Mahatma Gandhi
Voyaging through wildernesses is essential to the growth and maturity of the human spirit. - Steven Callahan
In nature there are neither rewards nor punishments; there are consequences. - R.G. Ingersoll
Why wilderness? Because we like the taste of freedom, because we like the smell of danger. - Edward Abbey
Look deep into nature, and then you will understand everything better. - Albert Einstein
The world breaks everyone, and afterward, some are strong at the broken places. - Ernest Hemingway
To live is to suffer, to survive is to find some meaning in the suffering. - Friedrich Nietzsche
You're never more alive than when you're almost dead. - Tim O'Brien
Endurance is not just the ability to bear a hard thing, but to turn it into glory. - William Barclay
The first virtue in a soldier is endurance; courage is only the second virtue. - Napoleon Bonaparte
If people think nature is their friend, then they sure don't need an enemy. - Kurt Vonnegut
The very basic core of a man's living spirit is his passion for adventure. - Christopher McCandless
With foxes we must play the fox. - Thomas Fuller
Fortune always favors the brave, and never helps a man who does not help himself. - P. T. Barnum
All that an obstacle does with brave men is, not to frighten them, but to challenge them. - Woodrow Wilson
If you don't hunt it down and kill it, it will hunt you down and kill you. - Flannery O'Connor
We are all sentenced to solitary confinement inside our own skins, for life. - Tennessee Williams
Being alone is scary, but not as scary as feeling alone. - Amelia Earhart
I have often marveled at the thin line which separates success from failure. - Ernest Shackleton
Freedom is something that dies unless it's used. - Hunter S. Thompson
The clearest way into the universe is through a forest wilderness - John Muir
Alone, we can do so little; together we can do so much. - Helen Keller
Without a family, man, alone in the world, trembles with the cold. - Andre Maurois

Coming together is a beginning, 
staying together is progress, 
and working together is success. - Henry Ford
Men argue. Nature acts. - Voltaire
Either men will learn to live like brothers, or they will die like beasts. - Max Lerner
Hell is other people. - Jean-Paul Sartre
The strength of the team is each individual member. The strength of each member is the team. - Phil Jackson
Heroism is endurance for one moment more. - George F. Kennan
Never confuse a single defeat with a final defeat. - F. Scott Fitzgerald
All men make mistakes, but only wise men learn from their mistakes. - Winston Churchill
It is not the mountains we conquer, but ourselves. - Sir Edmund Hillary
Nature, in her untamed state, is savage and unrelenting. - Fennel Hudson
Over every mountain there is a path, though it may not be seen from the valley. - Theodore Roethke
...we do not own these woods. They own us. - Timothy Goodwin
Redemption can be found in hell itself if that's where you happen to be. - Lin Jensen
Solitude, isolation are painful things, and beyond human endurance. - Jules Verne
The mountains are calling and I must go. - John Muir
By endurance we conquer. - Ernest Shackleton

seasonLocation: The Great Slave Lake in the Northwest Territories in Canada near the Lutselk'e
seasonQuotes: Our food lies ahead and death stalks us from behind. - Ernest Shackleton
Laws change; people die; the land remains. - Abraham Lincoln
This is no time for ease and comfort. It is the time to dare and endure. - Winston Churchill
A failure is not always a mistake... The real mistake is to stop trying. - B.F. Skinner
For suffering and enduring there is no remedy but striving and doing. - Thomas Carlyle
The most difficult thing is the decision to act. The rest is merely tenacity. - Amelia Earhart
Come what may, all bad fortune is to be conquered by endurance. - Virgil
He who conquers others is strong. He who conquers himself is mighty. - Lao Tzu
Wisdom comes alone through suffering. - Aeschylus
Adapt or perish, now as ever, is nature's inexorable imperative. - H.G. Wells
One day, in retrospect, the years of struggle will strike you as the most beautiful. - Sigmund Freud

seasonLocation: The Great Slave Lake in the Northwest Territories in Canada near the Lutselk'e
seasonQuotes: Whosoever is delighted in solitude is either a wild beast or a god. - Aristotle
Fortitude is the marshal of thought, the armor of the will, and the fort of reason. - Francis Bacon
Life is a walk through the forest. Don't fear the trees; fear what lurks behind them. - Richelle E. Goodrich
Let food be thy medicine and medicine be thy food. - Hippocrates
Failure is not fatal, but failure to change might be. - John Wooden
Chaos was the law of nature; Order was the dream of man. - Henry Adams
When you reach the end of your rope, tie a knot in it and hang on. - Franklin D. Roosevelt
To survive it is often necessary to fight and to fight you have to dirty yourself. - George Orwell
Let me not pray to be sheltered from dangers but to be fearless in facing them. - Rabindranath Tagore
Fate leads the willing, and drags along the reluctant. - Seneca
The best way out is always through. - Robert Frost
The worst cruelty that can be inflicted on a human being is isolation. - Sukarno
True wilderness can still be found, but it's hard to reach and dangerous when you get there. - Michelle Paver
It is not because things are difficult that we do not dare; it is because we do not dare that they are difficult. - Seneca
Men are not prisoners of fate, but only prisoners of their own minds. - Franklin D. Roosevelt
Only by going alone in silence, without baggage, can one truly get into the heart of the wilderness. - John Muir
Success is the sum of small efforts, repeated day in and day out. - Robert Collier
In nature there are neither rewards nor punishments; there are consequences. - Robert Green Ingersoll
I think nature's imagination is so much greater than man's, she's never going to let us relax. - Richard Feyman [sic]
We have nowhere else to goâ€¦ This is all we have. - Margaret Mead
Adversity has the effect of eliciting talents which in prosperous circumstances would have lain dormant. - Horace
The rewards for those who persevere far exceed the pain that must precede the victory. - Ted Engstrom
A journey of a thousand miles must begin with a single step. - Lao Tzu
Don't feel entitled to anything you didn't sweat and struggle for. - Marian Wright Edelman
The future depends on what we do in the present. - Mahatma Gandhi
It's on the strength of observation and reflection that one finds a way. - Claude Monet
One thorn of experience is worth a whole wilderness of warning. - James Russell Lowell
Success does not consist in never making mistakes but in never making the same one a second time. - George Bernard Shaw
And into the forest I go, to lose my mind and find my soul. - John Muir
Never to suffer would never to have been blessed. - Edgar Allen Poe [sic]
Never give up, for that is just the place and time that the tide will turn. - Harriet Beecher Stowe
Solitude was my only consolation - deep, dark, deathlike solitude. - Mary Shelley
Out of difficulties grow miracles. - Jean de La BruyÃ¨re
